1.summary: Immunity is strong today; body is adjusting to the start of the R-CHOP cycle. Energy may be fairly stable.
1.what_to_eat: Have dal-rice with ghee, roti with lauki or tori sabzi, paneer bhurji, boiled eggs, banana and apple. Include coconut water and moong dal khichdi if digestion feels heavy.
1.what_not_to_eat: Avoid fried pakoras, outside pav bhaji, restaurant noodles, and heavy masala dishes. Do not eat leftover street food or overly spicy snacks.
1.priorities: Stay hydrated with 3 L water + coconut water; maintain regular meals; work 5 to 6 hrs with breaks every 45 mins; keep stress low today.
1.avoid: Avoid unnecessary long outings; avoid crowded places; do not consume bakery junk like cream biscuits or packaged sweets.

2.summary: Immunity stays strong. Appetite may fluctuate but overall body is coping well.
2.what_to_eat: Have roti with spinach or methi sabzi, dal-khichdi, sprouts salad, paneer tikka at home, boiled eggs. Fruits like banana and pomegranate help maintain energy.
2.what_not_to_eat: Avoid outside sandwiches, creamy pasta, samosa, vada pav, or stale hotel food. No chivda or chips today.
2.priorities: Focus on hydration and regular meals; sit with ergonomic posture; take 10-min stretching breaks during laptop work.
2.avoid: Avoid going out for food or chai; avoid overeating rice at night; avoid late-night screen time.

3.summary: Immunity stable. Mild fatigue possible. Body still in stronger phase.
3.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, roti with cabbage or karela sabzi, paneer paratha with curd, sprouts chaat without oil, 1 to 2 boiled eggs for protein.
3.what_not_to_eat: Avoid chips, Kurkure, biscuits, bakery items, and outside dosa/idli which may be cooked in old oil.
3.priorities: Maintain good hydration; continue WFH with posture awareness; go for a short walk on terrace or outside (mask on).
3.avoid: Avoid long mall visits, public transport, or meeting too many people indoors.

4.summary: Immunity is still good but body begins settling into cycle. Slight dips in stamina may begin.
4.what_to_eat: Have moong dal khichdi, roti with bottle gourd or ridge gourd, paneer curry, fresh fruits like apple and banana, egg omelette if appetite is low.
4.what_not_to_eat: Avoid spicy Chinese, pani puri, chaat, and fried items from outside. Avoid too much curd at night.
4.priorities: Focus on maintaining energy; keep meals light but frequent; maintain hydration above 2.5 to 3 L.
4.avoid: Avoid unnecessary outings even though risk is low; avoid cold drinks and sweets.

5.summary: Immunity begins dropping into moderate zone. You may feel mild weakness.
5.what_to_eat: Eat dal-khichdi with ghee, roti with pumpkin or carrot sabzi, paneer bhurji, 1 to 2 boiled eggs, banana and apples. Prefer warm home-cooked meals.
5.what_not_to_eat: Avoid hotel food, stale roti-sabzi, chivda, chips, biscuits, and outside tea stalls.
5.priorities: Prioritize rest between work sessions; keep hydration high; ensure fresh cooked meals only.
5.avoid: Avoid meeting many outsiders; avoid long social gatherings; avoid heavy masala food.

6.summary: Immunity continues decreasing. You may notice lower stamina or light tiredness.
6.what_to_eat: Have roti with aloo-beans or tinda sabzi, dal-rice, paneer curry, sprouts with lemon, coconut water, boiled eggs if usual.
6.what_not_to_eat: Avoid all outside snacks like puff, samosa, pizzas, sandwiches, or oily home snacks.
6.priorities: Work 5 to x6 hrs with frequent breaks; maintain 3 L hydration; avoid stress.
6.avoid: Avoid stepping into crowded local markets; avoid eating from friends' plates or shared utensils.

7.summary: Immunity is now low-moderate. Body entering vulnerable window. Infection risk rising.
7.what_to_eat: Eat plain dal-rice, lauki sabzi, spinach dal, paneer in light gravy, boiled eggs, banana, apple. Prefer soft foods like khichdi if digestion feels weak.
7.what_not_to_eat: Avoid any restaurant food, pani puri, outside dosa, sweets from shops, and leftover cooked food >6 hrs old.
7.priorities: Prioritize hygiene; sanitize surfaces; take plenty of rest; keep your mask ready if outsiders come home.
7.avoid: Avoid going out socially; avoid long car rides with friends; avoid cold refrigerated foods.

8.summary: Immunity is severely low today. This is the high-risk period. Stay cautious.
8.what_to_eat: Eat fresh khichdi, plain dal-rice, roti with lauki or tori, paneer in mild gravy, boiled eggs, fruits like banana and apple. Prefer warm, freshly cooked meals only.
8.what_not_to_eat: Strictly avoid all outside food, chips, biscuits, chivda, cold foods, raw vegetables, and cut fruits from outside.
8.priorities: Rest as much as possible; maintain hygiene; wear a mask if anyone comes home; keep hydration above 3 L.
8.avoid: Avoid going outside unless essential; avoid meeting friends; avoid closed spaces with outsiders.

9.summary: One of the lowest immunity days. Body is vulnerable to infections.
9.what_to_eat: Have light moong dal khichdi, rice with ghee, roti with mild sabzi like lauki/ghiya, paneer burji, soft homemade upma if tolerated, banana and apples only when washed carefully.
9.what_not_to_eat: Avoid hotel food, bakery items, chai tapri items, packaged snacks, raw salads, and refrigerated leftovers.
9.priorities: Prioritize rest; keep your room clean; avoid long laptop sessions; drink warm water.
9.avoid: Avoid stepping out completely; avoid letting friends visit; avoid touching outside surfaces unnecessarily.

10.summary: Immunity remains at its lowest. Body needs maximum protection today.
10.what_to_eat: Eat fresh khichdi, dal-rice with minimal spice, roti with boiled vegetable sabzis, paneer in soft gravy, boiled eggs, coconut water, bananas.
10.what_not_to_eat: Avoid raw sprouts, onion-cucumber salads, outside sweets, biscuits, chips, fried snacks, and cold drinks.
10.priorities: Focus on rest, hygiene, and warm cooked food. Take shorter work sessions (30 to 40 mins) with breaks.
10.avoid: Strictly avoid outings, friends meet-ups, or allowing strangers into the home.

11.summary: Immunity still in the danger zone. Body slowly begins upward trend but risk is high.
11.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, light sabzis like tori, lauki, palak dal, paneer curry, soft rotis, boiled eggs, banana + apple. Coconut water helps maintain hydration.
11.what_not_to_eat: Avoid junk snacks, biscuits, maida items, leftover sabzi, cold stale food, and any outside meals.
11.priorities: Keep environment clean; maintain warm hydration; continue light meals; minimize laptop work if fatigued.
11.avoid: Avoid social contact; avoid leaving home; avoid touching pets or outdoor surfaces.

12.summary: Still in low-immunity stretch. Body is sensitive; infection risk remains high.
12.what_to_eat: Eat moong dal khichdi, soft rotis with lauki/palak sabzi, paneer bhurji, boiled eggs, fruits like banana and apple, curd only if fresh.
12.what_not_to_eat: Avoid spicy curries, oily sabzis, restaurant food, chivda, chips, biscuits, and refrigerated leftovers.
12.priorities: Rest well; maintain hydration; keep meals simple. Keep windows open for ventilation.
12.avoid: Avoid all outings including to friends’ homes. Avoid meeting groups or sharing food.

13.summary: Immunity begins improving but caution still needed. Energy slowly returning.
13.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, roti with spinach/pumpkin, paneer curry, boiled eggs, sprouts chaat (lightly steamed). Fruits like apple and banana are safe.
13.what_not_to_eat: Avoid outside food, bakery items, biscuits, and cold leftover foods.
13.priorities: Resume normal work hours with breaks; maintain hydration; light stretching.
13.avoid: Avoid crowded areas; short outdoor walk is okay with mask.

14.summary: Immunity moderately improving but body still recovering from low phase.
14.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, roti with cabbage or beans sabzi, paneer paratha with fresh curd, soft eggs. Include fruit like banana and mosambi juice.
14.what_not_to_eat: Avoid heavy masala curry, fried snacks, street food, and anything cooked in reused oil.
14.priorities: Focus on easing back into routine; maintain hydration above 2.5 L.
14.avoid: Avoid long social gatherings; short outings are okay if masked.

15.summary: Immunity climbing well; energy returning. Moderate risk still applies.
15.what_to_eat: Eat roti with methi or spinach sabzi, dal-khichdi, paneer tikka at home, boiled eggs, sprouts lightly steamed. Fruits like apple and pomegranate.
15.what_not_to_eat: Avoid samosa, vada pav, pizza, outside noodles, and packaged sweets.
15.priorities: Can work normally with proper posture; include light stretching and 10-min walk.
15.avoid: Avoid shared utensils; avoid meeting sick people.

16.summary: Immunity approaching strong levels but remain cautious. Fatigue decreasing.
16.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, roti with paneer sabzi, mung dal khichdi, boiled eggs, steamed sprouts. Include banana, apple and coconut water.
16.what_not_to_eat: Avoid maida-heavy foods, pani puri, sweet shops, and cold stored leftovers.
16.priorities: Maintain regular meals, hydration, and structured laptop work hours.
16.avoid: Avoid crowded cinemas or malls; short coffee outing is fine with mask.

17.summary: Immunity is now strong again. Energy stable. Body recovering well.
17.what_to_eat: Eat roti with paneer masala, dal-rice, sprouts chaat, omelette, bananas and apples. Can include homemade parathas.
17.what_not_to_eat: Avoid fast food, outside Chinese, and anything deep-fried.
17.priorities: Resume regular WFH schedule; light walks and stretching recommended.
17.avoid: Avoid unnecessary late-night outings; small meet-ups with close friends are okay with mask.

18.summary: Immunity strong; body functioning normally. Appetite likely improving.
18.what_to_eat: Have dal-rice, roti with beans or brinjal sabzi, paneer bhurji, boiled eggs, fruits like banana and grapes. Coconut water helps hydration.
18.what_not_to_eat: Avoid oily street food, bhel, sev puri, and junk snacks at home.
18.priorities: Stay active with light exercise; maintain hydration; return to stable routine.
18.avoid: Avoid very crowded social places; short outdoor visits are okay.

19.summary: Immunity remains strong. Near full recovery phase before next cycle.
19.what_to_eat: Eat dal, roti with spinach/palak sabzi, paneer curry, omelette, sprouts, bananas and apples. Healthy home snacks like roasted chana are okay.
19.what_not_to_eat: Avoid pizzas, burgers, and packaged chips; avoid cold juice from outside.
19.priorities: Focus on good nutrition; maintain normal work schedule; stay hydrated.
19.avoid: Avoid unnecessary travel; short friend meetups are okay outdoors.

20.summary: Immunity solid. Body is in stable condition. Prepare for next cycle soon.
20.what_to_eat: Have dal-rice, roti with paneer masala or mixed veg, boiled eggs, steamed sprouts, bananas and coconut water.
20.what_not_to_eat: Avoid deep fried snacks, stale foods, and overly spicy curries.
20.priorities: Keep stress low; maintain hydration; continue 10-min stretching breaks.
20.avoid: Avoid very late-night outings; small masked meetups are fine.

21.summary: Immunity high and stable. This is near-peak recovery.
21.what_to_eat: Eat roti with aloo-methi or paneer, dal-rice, sprouts chaat, 1 to 2 eggs, fruits like banana and apple. Homemade paratha is fine.
21.what_not_to_eat: Avoid unhealthy snacks like chips/chivda and outside chaat.
21.priorities: Stay active, hydrated, and keep meals regular. Good day for light chores or short outdoor walk.
21.avoid: Avoid crowded indoor restaurants; outdoor café is okay with mask.

22.summary: Immunity at its strongest in this cycle. Body fully recovered.
22.what_to_eat: Eat dal-rice, roti with paneer sabzi, mixed veg curries, eggs, sprouts, banana and apple. Hydrate with coconut water.
22.what_not_to_eat: Avoid heavy junk food, pani puri, and any greasy outside snacks.
22.priorities: Prepare mentally and nutritionally for next chemo cycle; maintain calm and stable routine.
22.avoid: Avoid unnecessary tiring activities; enjoy light social interactions safely.
